title: Joint venture partnering: A way to bring technology to the market
segmentation: Hello to everybody.
My name is Richard and each aimco I'm founder and CEO of the company culture and it's with money or in English challenge consultancy services.
Our company company is focused on.

The corporate development of fast growing or merging high tech businesses and our special specialty is basically creating business models and collaboration models for the needs of those high tech businesses.

Around our customers are not only Slovenian based customers, I can tell you that we are month ago we also signed some contracts with Russian enterprises, which their goal is to come into worldwide with its technology existing and in progress.
My focus today is basically.
Trying to explain or explain a little bit.
If you decide that you want come with your own technology by yourself that basically you needs or you prefer to join with somebody to put this technology.
Into the market on this approach.
What basically is joint venture?
There is many misunderstanding what joint ventures are or are not.
What do they consist of and to be correct, there is no precise legal meaning.
In Slovenian language we have.
We have expressions scoop, no podia tear scooping interiors.
Also, the levono in English we have partnerships, joint ventures, strategic alliances.
But basically, what is what is?
What is the focus of this kind of joint ventures?
Basically this is Association of independent entities.
Primarily these companies.
Business oriented could be also public.
For example, public research organization.
It doesn't matter, and this Association of those entities combined resources for defined commercial purpose to share risk.
And of course, if succeeded to share rewards.
And basically in theory or in practice, we have two ways of this kind of joint ventures when we created.

A separate entities which are basically based on joint venture agreement and the incorporation is the final step of how to approach into the market and then we have contractual arrangements such as strategic licensing, distribution or development agreements which are obligation wise agreement between.
The core principles and core topics which need to be declared that need to be clarified among them.
As we said, there is no common definition of joint venture.
There is also very different different times of joint ventures or collaborations as mentioned for me and for my colleagues which.
Based on on legal understanding, joint venture agreement basically means incorporated.
The final result is establishing a new company.

The other part is so-called virtual joint ventures, which is contractual based and basically it is understood collaboration agreement where a popular in Slovenia Strategic Alliance agreement which is much more preferable in high tech and cross border businesses.
And there are various other types of collaboration agreements.
Co. Branding Co Marketing Co, promotion, joint development agreement and Pure revenue sharing agreement.
But to clarify revenue sharing topics, I usually always include it in.
Also in joint venture agreements, we will tell a little bit.
More.
When we will come to the to the point.
Of course, every type of your business activity is.
Should be regarded as pluses and minuses of it, and what are advantages of joint venture approach.
We said the first approach is you will do it everything by yourself and the other one you will collaborate with somebody to reach your goals.
But you must do a little bit more.
The primary advantages of joint ventures are let's have in mind.
We have technology or we have IP or something like that.
We will try to put it into the market and the primary advantage is diversification of resources, technologies, expertise, expertise, markets and customers.
What does this mean?
That means that every joint venture agreement is basically agreement of what?

A single or individual partner partner will bring into the this type of collaboration and on the asset sites we're talking about real estate equipment, human resources and intangible assets, As for example, but very important assets As for example, intellectual property or intellectual property rights.
The other thing which is very important, your knowledge, your expertise, markets you are in.
Already and we all know who we are working on.
The business environment that it is very important that you understand the market that you are recognized in the market and this is of a huge value.
Obviously, and of course your customers, which can also be treated as a customers for new products or for joint venture purpose.
With this kind of joint ventures you can enter into a new businesses you are not at home at the moment, but you have a need to come into the new business.
We won't talk today about the sharing the risk, but this is 1.
The main reason why.

Companies running into new businesses to widen their business portfolio, but especially to minimize risks if we have just one business, the other one is geographic approach to the market, which is also important.
You can leverage partners competence is.
You can you can share or minimize the risks already existed.
You can maximize efficiency and economies of scale.
Of course, as we set what you put on your asset sites into the joint venture.

It is very important that all those resources are maximized and basically, but you will always trying to find a partner which is complementary to knots in the partner which has basically the same assets for portfolio.
In this joint venture it will this kind of.
Approach will also give you flexibility regarding turn of commitment and potential exposure and basically this is alternative to two.
Capital constraints and costs of mergers and acquisitions.
Basically, a lot of companies are trying to to find smaller companies.
To acquire them and then trying to.
To get in this kind trying to get IP trying to get market business and so on.
But reality.
Of mergers and acquisitions and joint ventures and other part of alliances.
The result is this one.
These are datas from from 2009 and I'm sure that didn't change a lot mergers and acquisitions.
The percentage of winners is very low.
I won't discuss reasons why, but just to remember those old rule which is saying if you can't beat them.
Join him.
There are all always disadvantages of one thing.
For one thing is good for the other, one is bad.
But all those disadvantages are also subject to rethinking what is good in the next step or in time in time.
And for example, time consuming and potentially complex to structure joint venture.
Yes it is.
It's correct, you must be focused on Mary on many aspects of your collaboration, but my personal opinion is it is worth.

To do it at the beginning, not trying to solve the potential problems in the futures you didn't discuss with your partner when they think is going on, you will have problems with different approach, different way of thinking and you are in danger with this collaboration.
Joint mean really joint.
It's like marriage.
Well, the other thing is that it requires diligence on partner, objective, structure, governance and so on.
These are topics especially in Slovenia which are not so common to speak about them or to negotiate with them and to make agreements and then.
But it is very important.
There are other things I said to you.
It's like a marriage ongoing trust and maintenance of relationship with joint venture partner and continued agreement and alignment with joint venture partner.
It is a story.

It's a relation which is running into the time period and during the time partners are changing and relations are changing and also as a focal joint venture is also changing and at the end the old good, beautiful things are always.
Prone to be ended, it requires and.
Exit strategy for you.

I will show you just one slide, which is basically a relation between when you are IP contributor and what basically owners of the joint venture or the majority the leader of the these kind of partnerships is looking for your as owner of the IP.
Your basic concern is how to control rights of your IP.

And your technology portfolio and on the other hand it is obvious interest that who is John Rancher owner that he needs a sufficient contribution of IP and technology for the joint venture to succeed.
You must put this in balance.
With with basically with the common agreement, and then with the special agreements which are or normally associated with joint ventures agreements, you have always a separate agreement regarding IP.
This is basically.
A summary of IP issues regarding this kind of penetration into the market.
And basically it's a questionnaire.
What IP will be contributed by each partner to the joint venture?
What field of use and what terms?
To be used as I mentioned before.
The other thing is a question where we there any ongoing obligations to contribut IP means further development when you have something you must contribute it into the into the partnership.
It's called hunting license, but is something special but you need to be careful on that.
You can put also limitations on that, but you put your joint venture into the risk of that, especially when you are looking into the goals of the joint venture.
There is always a question of background and foreground of IP.
It's nothing new.
Everybody who is working on framework agreements with the with European Union.
There is also talk about the foreground background and with joint ventures is the same story.
Foreground means a new knowledge, new knowledge that basically we can say will will be established in the in the joint venture.
How's the share house with the use that?
But the new knowledge didn't come from the scratch.
This is illusion.
That's why we need to also talk about the background of your knowledge.
Basically, the background is the knowledge partners bring or brought into the joint venture as their own knowledge.
You need to be careful about that and you need a common understanding about.
Use in for the joint venture purposes and for the use of other partners.
Is it allowed for them to use your background for their purposes?
There is, there are different solutions.
For example, many partners allow them for further research and development for other partners, but not for penetration into the market which is excluded order.
Strict intent to be into the joint venture and the end of the story when we set the marriage is finished, we need to settle out.
Who owns IP?
On termination we are talking about the new knowledge and questions about the.
Background as I already spoke to summarize, somehow somehow my topic which is important, Lee just 15 minutes minutes long.
It is very important to understand yours and your partner's interest and goals.
Are they consistent with you or especially complimentary to you?
And if they will change in time, really, please think in time.
This is very important.
All relations are based on thinking in time.
The next thing shared vision among the partners and how to move forward.
Very important questions.
The governance control funding product development return, trash hold and so on.
In Slovenia we don't have a lot of practice in this, but it is important.
We are thinking in boxes, more thinking in relations who will control who will be the leader who will, who will be obliged when the call for additional funding is made?
Who will contribute this?
How will go with the product development if.
If this is not planned already, but it's a, it's a need to do it, and so on.
And especially our joint venture partners compatible business culture approach to compliance compatibility of employees.
Who will work on John Blanchard is a very important topic.
It's basically the same as it is with mergers and acquisitions and just to tell you.
Basically 90% of mergers and acquisitions, collapses or failures based on on topics that the business culture of the companies and.
And employees differences are so big that this is the reason for failure.
Uh.
The other thing is you also must consider if in the future.
Partners can compete with John Venture.
This is not exemption.
This is very likely to happen in time and you can lock it.
With this that you are taking care especially on that and you can lock it also with the initial business plan, an budget to protect.
These kinds of thinking and basically acting in the market in the future.
In the first step it's not so visible, but on the next step become visible and it's very difficult to stop this kind of.
Behavior of.
Of the partner.
This is what I intended to tell you, and the next thing is to kindly ask you if you have any questions regarding my presentation.
Maybe I have a question for you this, anybody if you already deal with kind of joint venture agreements or collaboration agreements which were mentioned?
Already.
Nope.
Well to tell you honestly, I'm allowed to tell you that few centers of excellence which were created in 2009.
Are starting to use joint venture agreement contractual wise at the moment to collaborate with the partners which are outside of the center of excellence.
And I can tell you honestly that the company says import or store is still which on the technology edge in the in the areas where there are involved.
Science joint venture agreements with those centers of excellence for the further development of the technologies, which is a core research and development focus of those centers of excellence.
And I think this is a very good opportunity to stormi that.
And if and if needed, those joint ventures will be converted into the incorporated version of of the collaboration.
It started also in Slovenia, but in the rest of the world it's very common now to create this kind of collaborations.
If not, I won't force you to make questions for any price and in this regard I would like to say thank you for the invitation and for the opportunity to tell something about those topics.
Thank you very much.
